title: The Last Night (1949 film)
text:
The Last Night () is a 1949 German <a href="drama%20film">drama film</a> directed by <a href="Eugen%20York">Eugen York</a> and starring <a href="Sybille%20Schmitz">Sybille Schmitz</a>, <a href="Karl%20John%20%28actor%29">Karl John</a>, <a href="Margarete%20Haagen">Margarete Haagen</a>.
It was made by the <a href="Hamburg">Hamburg</a>-based company <a href="Real%20Film">Real Film</a>. The film's sets were designed by <a href="Herbert%20Kirchhoff">Herbert Kirchhoff</a>.
The film is set in <a href="German-occupied%20France">German-occupied France</a> in 1944 where a female <a href="French%20resistance">resistance</a> operative and a German army officer fall in love. It was not a box office success on its release.
